front: [砖专专转] Based on Sciancalepore Francesco et al. (2025), what clinical practice change might be considered?
back:
Finding: Numerous MRI-based studies have shown that frailty is associated with vascular brain damage, mostly consisting of increased white matter hyperintensity volumes, and with reduced gray matter volumes

Clinical relevance: Consider this evidence when treating elderly patients with frailty-related conditions.

 Full study: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41253248/
